conditions.name: Weber Syndrome
conditions.reference_diagnosis: Left midbrain infarction (Weber syndrome) with ipsilateral CN III palsy and contralateral hemiparesis

conditions.name: Wallenberg Syndrome
conditions.reference_diagnosis: Left lateral medullary infarction (Wallenberg syndrome) with ipsilateral facial sensory loss, Horner's syndrome, ataxia, and contralateral body sensory loss

patients.name: James Wilson
patients.existing_condition: poorly controlled hypertension and smoking history

conditions.name: Millard-Gubler Syndrome
conditions.reference_diagnosis: Left ventral pontine infarction (Millard-Gubler syndrome) with ipsilateral CN VI and CN VII palsy and contralateral hemiparesis

conditions.name: Lateral Pontine Syndrome
conditions.reference_diagnosis: Left lateral pontine infarction (AICA territory) with ipsilateral CN VII, CN VIII palsy, ataxia, and contralateral pain/temperature loss

conditions.name: Medial Medullary Syndrome
conditions.reference_diagnosis: Left medial medullary infarction (Dejerine syndrome) with ipsilateral CN XII palsy, contralateral hemiparesis, and contralateral proprioception loss

conditions.name: Multiple Sclerosis Brainstem
conditions.reference_diagnosis: Multiple sclerosis with brainstem involvement causing internuclear ophthalmoplegia and sensory symptoms
